title: The Fed’s Inflation Blind Spot
text:
How muted is inflation, really? The answer to that question has depended a lot lately on what inflation measure you are looking at.

The Federal Reserve’s preferred inflation measure—the price index for personal-consumption expenditures —has been running cool. Crucially, this is the index its 2% inflation target is based on. The Commerce Department reported Friday that the overall PCE price index was flat in August from July, putting it up just 1.4% from a year earlier. Core prices, which exclude food and energy items to better...
description: How muted is inflation, really? The answer to that question has depended a lot lately on what inflation measure you are looking at.
